1. Yellow traffic signs:
column8: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 12. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column6: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column10: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.

column2: 13. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column10: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

column10: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.

column2: 22. This road sign warns drivers that:

column10: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 23. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.
column6: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
column8: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.
column10: Drivers are not required to stop.

column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.

column10: steer the car into the direction of the skid.

column6: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column8: pass slower vehicles on the right.

column2: 39. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column6: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
column10: The last driver to reach the intersection.

column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.

46. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 47. When approaching a railroad crossing that has no warning signals (such as electric flashing lights or gates) a driver should look, listen and slow down.
48. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.
column6: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.
column8: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column10: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.

column2: 49. BAC is expressed in:
column8: ounces of alcohol in your blood.
